text.content:
Shadow of the Weird Wizard system has community-provided support for the following languages:

  • Brazilian Portuguese (Português Brasileiro)

  • German (Deutsch)

You can read more about it in Foundry's documentation.

Changing the Language

If you wish to change the system's language, head to the Game Settings tab, then open Configure Settings. Scroll down to Language Preference and select the language you wish to use.

Once confirmed, Foundry will need to be refreshed for the changes to be applied.

Foundry Core's Interface

The localizations included in the Weird Wizard system is for the system interface only.

If you wish to also localize Foundry core's interface, head to Translation and Localization in Foundry VTT's website and find the appropriate localization module of your choice.

To speed up the test, here are some example modules, one for each supported language:

  • Translation [Core]: Tradução para Português Brasileiro

  • German [Core]

If a localization module is installed and enabled, changing the Language Preference will also apply Foundry core's localization to the interface.

If you wish to contribute to a localization of a language in particular, read below.

Contributing to an Existing Language

If the language is already supported, please join our Discord server, head to the localization channel under Join the Party category and then find the dedicated post for the language you want to help with.

The file that needs to be changed is located in <Foundry's data path>/systems/weirdwizard/lang folder (GitHub). The English file, for example, is en.json.

Once discussed and approved by the community, you can either submit a pull request in the system's GitHub repository yourself or ask the Development Team in Discord to do so.

Thanks for the contribution!

Adding a New Language

In order to add a new language to the system, please join our Discord server, head to the localization channel under Join the Party category and then drop a message in Requests for the Dev Team.

Once discussed, you'll need to create a new language file and provide information to the system's manifest.

Creating a Language File

You'll need to make a copy of en.json file located in <Foundry's data path>/systems/weirdwizard/lang folder (GitHub).

The copy must be named using the appropriate ISO 639-2 code. English, for example, is en.

If you wish to specify a regional language variation, such as Brazilian Portuguese, then make sure to add the ISO country code to the file name, such as in pt-BR.

Manifest Information

You'll also need to alter the code below with:

  • The language code, such as pt-BR.

  • The display name for the language, such as Português Brasileiro (Brazilian Portuguese).

  • The file path, such as lang/pt-BR.json.

{
    "lang": "en",
    "name": "English",
    "path": "lang/en.json"
}

This code will be included on the system's manifest, system.json (GitHub), in order for the localization to be recognized by Foundry.
